Key Match Events: Zach Edey finished with 12 points, six rebounds, two assists, three steals, and one block in the Grizzlies' 134-89 win over the Blazers.
The game was a blowout, with the Grizzlies leading by 38 points entering the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Zach Edey was not in the starting lineup due to injuries and entered the game in the first quarter.
Coach Taylor Jenkins opted to go small with a lineup including Scotty Pippen Jr., Jaylen Wells, Santi Aldama, Jaren Jackson Jr., and Brandon Clarke.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Jenkins highlighted Edey's need to learn from his turnovers and adjust to the league's speed.
The Grizzlies improved to 7-4 on the season despite early injuries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Edey re-entered the game with a significant lead and struggled in garbage time with limited impact.
The Grizzlies' victory was their second against the Blazers this season.
